testCases.label: returns length of a string
testCases.description: Verifies that getStringLength correctly returns the number of characters in a given string.

testCases.label: gets character at valid index (middle)
testCases.description: Checks that getCharacterAtIndex returns the correct character when given a string and a valid index in the middle of the string.

testCases.label: gets character at valid index (other case)
testCases.description: Checks that getCharacterAtIndex returns the correct character for a different string and index combination.

testCases.label: finds index of existing character
testCases.description: Ensures that getIndexGivenCharacter returns the index of a character that appears in the string (e.g., 'b' in "zebra" returns 2).

testCases.label: returns -1 when character not found
testCases.description: Ensures that getIndexGivenCharacter returns -1 when the specified character does not appear in the string (e.g., 'q' in "banana").

testCases.label: extracts substring from string (case 1)
testCases.description: Verifies that partOfString returns the correct substring for a given start and end index.

testCases.label: extracts substring from string (case 2)
testCases.description: Checks that partOfString correctly extracts a different substring range from the input string.

testCases.label: compares strings lexicographically (less than)
testCases.description: Ensures that compareLexigraphically returns a negative value or indicator when the first string comes before the second lexicographically.

testCases.label: compares strings lexicographically (greater than)
testCases.description: Ensures that compareLexigraphically returns a positive value or indicator when the first string comes after the second lexicographically.

testCases.label: compares strings lexicographically (equal)
testCases.description: Ensures that compareLexigraphically indicates equality when two strings are lexicographically equal.

testCases.label: splits string around delimiter (spaces)
testCases.description: Verifies that splitStringIntoMultipleStrings splits the input string around spaces into the expected array of substrings.

testCases.label: splits string around regex delimiter (period)
testCases.description: Verifies that splitStringIntoMultipleStrings splits "src.main.java" around periods into {"src", "main", "java"}, using an escaped regex delimiter.

testCases.label: concatenates two alphabetic strings
testCases.description: Checks that combine concatenates "abc" and "xyz" into "abcxyz".

testCases.label: concatenates two numeric strings
testCases.description: Checks that combine concatenates "123" and "456" into "123456".
